title: Jackie Shute
text:
John Lawson "Jackie" Shute (31 January 1901 – 23 November 1988) was a <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player who represented Australia.
Shute, a <a href="Wing%20%28rugby%20union%29">wing</a>, was born near Sydney and claimed a total of 3 international rugby caps for Australia.
He was later chairman of the Australian Meat Board. He was appointed an Officer of the <a href="Order%20of%20the%20British%20Empire">Order of the British Empire</a> (OBE) in the <a href="1959%20Birthday%20Honours">1959 Birthday Honours</a> and a Companion of the <a href="Order%20of%20St%20Michael%20and%20St%20George">Order of St Michael and St George</a> (CMG) in the <a href="1970%20New%20Year%20Honours">1970 New Year Honours</a>, for public services.
